result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark C Cannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. SEIZED MONEY TO BE USED TO PAY FINE.  STATE TO HAVE RELEASED FROM RPD AND FORWARD TO THE CLERK OF COURTS.  PAYMENT PLAN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE COSTS TO BEGIN ON NOVEMBER 1, 2022 AT $100/MONTH.
Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark C Cannon

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM Defendant Mark C Cannon in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Mark C Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Upon plea to Ct. 1 the parties stipulate to a fine of $1000 plus court costs.  There was seized money and the State asks that it be released for the payment of the fine.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defense makes correction to the complaint.  Defense believes only $1300 was seized, but the complaint states $3200.  The State will follow up on this.  BTC: Correction of the complaint taken under advisement.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  
Plea:
Ct. 1- NC
BTC:
Ct. 1- $1000 FINE, COURT COSTS, DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE, FAW/VOTE.  SEIZED MONEY TO BE USED TOWARDS FINE, STATE TO DO THE RELEASE OF MONEY AND PROVIDE TO THE CLERK OF COURTS.  PAYMENT PLAN OF $100/MONTH BEGINNING ON NOVEMBER 1, 2022.

9:29 AM Defendant Mark C Cannon in court.  Attorney Barry J Braatz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Mark C Cannon. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Deft. has tested negative this morning.  Defense asks for a COP/sent.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark C Cannon not in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Mark C Cannon. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Defense has no explanation for the non appearance.  State requests a warrant.  Defense requests it be stayed.  BTC:  No appearance by defendant, Arrest/Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond to be forfeited. ** STAYED FOR 48 HOURS**

***CASE RECALLED AT 11:52AM.  DEFENDANT NOW APPEARS.  OTHER APPEARANCES ARE THE SAME.  The defendant had written the time down wrong.  BTC: Vacate Warrant.  Defendant has tested negative this morning.  Court admonishes the defendant on reporting to RCAP.  Defense is asking for another status.  Defense is discussing motions with the deft.  The State will tender an offer.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

9:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark C Cannon in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Mark C Cannon. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark C Cannon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Mark C Cannon. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
